original: Dhammapaccanīya (2), Dukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (2)🔽8.5. Hetuhetusampayuttaduka🔽Nahetuñceva nahetuvippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu ceva nahetuvippayutto ca dhammo
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  hetu hetu sampayutta duka  na hetum ca iva na hetu vippayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na hetu ca iva na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca dhammaḥ
translated: The Dhamma Section in Pairs, according to Antecedents🔽The dyad beginning with “with cause and with object”

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuñceva nahetuvippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetuvippayutto🔽ceva na nahetu ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuñceva nahetuvippayuttañca dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca nahetu ceva nahetuvippayutto ca nahetuvippayutto ceva na nahetu ca dhammā
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetum ca iva na hetu vippayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na hetu vippayuttaḥ  ca iva na na hetu ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetuñca iva na hetu vippayuttañca dhamma  paṭicca na hetu ceva na hetu vippayutto ca na hetu vippayutto ceva na na hetu ca dhammā
translated: With respect to the dyad beginning with “with cause and with object”: With respect to the dyad beginning with “with cause and with object,” the following should be noted:🔽With respect to the dyad beginning with “with cause and with object,” the following should be noted:

original: uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Nahetuvippayuttañceva na nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetuvippayutto ceva na nahetu
analyzed: uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na hetu vippayuttam ca iva na na hetum ca dhammam paṭicca na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca iva na na hetu
translated: With respect to the dyad beginning with “with cause and with object,” the following should be noted:🔽With respect to the dyad beginning with “with cause and with object,” the following should be noted:

original: ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuvippayuttañceva na nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetu vippayuttam ca iva na na hetum ca dhammam paṭicca
translated: With respect to the dyad beginning with “with cause and with object,” the following should be noted:

original: nahetu ceva nahetuvippayutto ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuvippayuttañceva
analyzed: na hetu ca iva na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetu vippayuttam ca iva
translated: A state that is not a root and is not related to a root arises related to a root condition. A state that is not related to a root and is not a root …

original: na nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu ceva nahetuvippayutto ca nahetuvippayutto ceva🔽na nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Nahetuñceva nahetuvippayuttañca nahetuvippayuttañceva na nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu ceva nahetuvippayutto ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca na hetu ca iva na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca iva  na na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na hetum ca iva na hetu vippayuttam ca na hetu vippayuttam ca iva na na hetum ca dhammam paṭicca na hetu ca iva na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A state that is not a root and is not associated with a root has arisen with root-cause as condition. A state that is not a root and is not dissociated from a root … A state that is not a root and is not associated with a root and a state that is not a root and is not dissociated from a root have arisen with root-cause as condition.🔽A state that is not a root and is not associated with a root and a state that is not a root and is not dissociated from a root have arisen with root-cause as condition. … three. (Abbreviated.)

analyzed: hetuyā nava pe avigate nava sabbattha vitthāro
translated: With root-cause as condition, nine … with non-conflict as condition, nine. (In all sections the explanation is to be given in detail.)
